edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol

Class SigmaProver

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.SigmaProver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SigmaProtocolProver

    public class SigmaProver
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProtocolProver
    This class manages the communication functionality of all the sigma protocol provers.

    It sends the first message, receives the challenge from the prover and sends the second message.

    It uses SigmaComputation instance of a concrete sigma protocol to compute the actual messages.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Method Detail

      • prove

        public void prove(SigmaProverInput input)
           throws CheatAttemptException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Runs the proof of this protocol.

        This function executes the proof at once by calling the following functions one by one.

        This function can be called when a user does not want to save time by doing operations in parallel.

        Specified by:
        prove in interface SigmaProtocolProver
        Parameters:
        input -
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException - if the received challenge's length is not equal to the soundness parameter.
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem during the communication phase.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem during the serialization mechanism.

      • processFirstMsg

        public void processFirstMsg(SigmaProverInput input)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Processes the first step of the sigma protocol.

        "SAMPLE a random values

        COMPUTE first message

        SEND the computed message to the verifier".

        It computes the first message and sends it to the verifier.

        Specified by:
        processFirstMsg in interface SigmaProtocolProver
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if failed to send the message.

      • processSecondMsg

        public void processSecondMsg()
                      throws CheatAttemptException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Processes the second step of the sigma protocol.

        "RECEIVE challenge from verifier

        COMPUTE second message

        SEND the computed message to the verifier".

        This is a blocking function!

        Specified by:
        processSecondMsg in interface SigmaProtocolProver
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException - if the received challenge's length is not equal to the soundness parameter.
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem during the communication phase.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem during the serialization mechanism.
